titleStmt.title: William Carter to James F. Robinson
CWG8896

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: Princeton Caldwell County Ky June the 10th 1863.

To his Exelency the Gov. of Ky. enclosed I send you a stamp. if you have any doubt as to my position or connector, as a citizen, a public or privet man. if you know any man in my County pleas write to him. for information I was born and Raised in this County and never Resided elsewhare. and I am geting old. and infurm. have a dependant familey and very limited means. and if compeled. to pay the fine which has been assessed against me it will fall heavly upon me. you will se the letter. of Judg Turner, who has been the County Judge of this County for the last 8 years. and a strong Union man. and what R B Ratliff. sais who is the presant sheriff, and a strong union man. you will see the petition in my behalf. I was advised that it was not nesasary to send many names, if you think a stronger petition nesasary. let me know and I have know doubt I can get four fifth of the men in my County. by Referance you will see I have been a magistrate for the last 12 years. Verry Truley yours --
Pettn of Will Carter of Caldwell County to remit fine
Fine remitted except Two Hundred & fifty dollars & costs
